skill.name: deslop
skill.description: Remove AI-generated code slop from a branch. Use when cleaning up AI-generated code, removing unnecessary comments, defensive checks, or type casts. Checks diff against main and fixes style inconsistencies.
skill.summary: Remove AI-generated code slop from a branch. Use when cleaning up AI-generated code, removing unnece...
skill.author: getsentry

security_audit.summary: Pure prompt-based skill with no executable code. Only provides behavioral guidelines for reviewing and cleaning code patterns. No file access, network calls, or command execution beyond what the AI platform inherently provides.

content.value_statement: AI-generated code often includes excessive comments, defensive checks, and unnecessary patterns. This skill reviews git diffs against main and systematically removes code slop while preserving legitimate changes.
actual_capabilities: Review git diff against main branch
Eliminate unnecessary defensive checks and try/catch blocks
Fix inline imports and type casts to any
limitations: Only operates on changed files in the current branch
Cannot undo or restore deleted code
Does not handle unrelated code quality issues

use_cases.title: Clean Your Feature Branches
use_cases.description: Remove AI-generated patterns before submitting pull requests for cleaner code review

use_cases.title: Enforce Code Standards
use_cases.description: Systematically identify and flag AI slop patterns in submitted code changes

use_cases.title: Maintain Codebase Quality
use_cases.description: Ensure AI-assisted contributions meet team style guidelines before merge

prompt_templates.title: Basic Branch Cleanup
prompt_templates.prompt: Use the deslop skill to clean up this branch. Review the diff against main and remove all AI-generated slop.

prompt_templates.title: Remove Comments Only
prompt_templates.prompt: Use deslop to remove only the extra comments from this branch. Keep defensive checks and try/catch blocks.

prompt_templates.title: Full Slop Removal
prompt_templates.prompt: Run deslop with full scope. Remove comments, defensive checks, type casts to any, and inline imports.

prompt_templates.title: Report Only Mode
prompt_templates.prompt: Use deslop to identify all slop patterns in this branch. Report what should be removed without making changes.

output_examples.input: Use deslop to clean up my current feature branch against main
output: Removed 12 excessive comments from src/utils.ts and src/api.ts
Eliminated 3 unnecessary defensive null checks in validated codepaths
Fixed 2 inline Python imports to top-of-file format
Summary: Cleaned up AI patterns while preserving 5 legitimate feature changes

best_practices: Review slop suggestions before accepting changes to ensure legitimate code is preserved
Run deslop after AI code generation but before committing to keep diffs clean
Use deslop during code review to maintain consistent codebase style
anti_patterns: Applying deslop to branches with unrelated changes from other contributors
Running deslop without reviewing what will be removed first
Expecting deslop to fix logic bugs or improve algorithmic efficiency

faq.question: Does deslop work with all git workflows?
faq.answer: Yes. deslop works with any git-based workflow. It uses git diff main...HEAD by default.

faq.question: What patterns does deslop remove?
faq.answer: Excessive comments, defensive checks, type casts to any, inline imports, and other style inconsistencies.

faq.question: Can deslop integrate with CI/CD pipelines?
faq.answer: Deslop is an AI skill, not a CI tool. Use it during development or code review phases.

faq.question: Is my code safe with deslop?
faq.answer: Deslop only provides guidelines to the AI. All changes require your approval before being applied.

faq.question: Why are my legitimate changes being removed?
faq.answer: Deslop may misinterpret some patterns. Review suggestions carefully and restore any legitimate code manually.

faq.question: How does deslop differ from linters?
faq.answer: Linters enforce syntax rules. Deslop targets AI-specific code patterns that linters cannot detect.
